description: The Republican South Dakota governor details what she says was a tough decision to shoot an "untrainable" family dog in a forthcoming memoir. Animal rights advocates and Democrats decried the move.
title: Trump VP contender Kristi Noem responds to backlash over story about killing her dog

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticized ongoing campus protests across the U.S. as antisemitic. The Vermont senator said it was an attempt to "deflect attention" from Israel's actions.
title: Bernie Sanders says Netanyahu is attacking campus protests to deflect war criticism

description: Hamas has released a video showing two captives, one of them an American, as part of an effort to prove that the two men are still alive. It was the second video of a U.S. citizen released this week.
title: Hamas releases video of a second American being held hostage in Gaza

description: Members of the Washington, D.C., school Arab students club say their rights were violated "because the school does not want their viewpoint ... to be heard."
title: A student club is suing its school, saying its pro-Palestinian views were censored

description: On the risky journey from the Global South to Europe, migrants often perish. In a town in Bosnia-Herzegovina, near a river where dozens have drowned, citizens seek to provide closure to the families.
title: An illegal migrant, age 17, drowned in a Bosnian river. Here's how citizens responded

description: A new regulation to protect the rights of pregnant workers is the subject of an anti-abortion lawsuit because it includes abortion as a pregnancy "related medical condition."
title: What abortion politics has to do with new rights for pregnant workers

description: The French Iranian author and artist, best known for her graphic novel Persepolis, edited and contributed to a new graphic anthology titled Woman, Life, Freedom, inspired by Iran's recent protests.
title: Iran women's protests are the focus of 'Persepolis' author Marjane Satrapi's new book

description: Johnson is the sixth Republican elevated to the speakership since 1994. The five who preceded him all saw their time in the office end in relative degrees of defeat or frustration.
title: Mike Johnson and the troubled history of recent Republican speakers

description: South Africans celebrate their "Freedom Day" every April 27, when they remember their country's pivotal first democratic election in 1994 that announced the official end of apartheid.
title: South Africa remembers an historic election every April 27, Freedom Day

description: Tornadoes wreaked havoc Friday in the Midwest, causing a building to collapse with dozens of people inside and destroying and damaging hundreds of homes, many around Omaha, Nebraska.
title: Tornadoes collapse buildings and level homes in Nebraska and Iowa
